"I figured I'd make you feel at home," Biden said as he played the song. The K-pop group had met Biden last week to discuss the rise in anti-Asian hate crimes.

176.title: 3 kids out to play after lunch get trapped in car in Tamil Nadu, die
176.article_body: Three children aged seven, five and four died of suspected suffocation after they got trapped inside a car while they were playing after lunch on June 4. Reports said that the car's doors could only be opened from outside. The parents of the children found them lying unconscious inside the car and broke into the vehicle with help from passersby.

177.title: Wildfire spreads near Greek capital; houses, cars damaged
177.article_body: Buoyed by intense winds, a wildfire spread on the outskirts of the Greek capital Athens that damaged cars and houses, said the Fire Department. The authorities have ordered evacuation in parts of the Voula and Glyfada regions. More than 130 firefighters, six firefighting aircraft and four helicopters were deployed to control the fire.

178.title: Bhumi participates in a plantation drive in Nainital on World Environment Day
178.article_body: On the occasion of World Environment Day, Bhumi Pednekar planted saplings in Nainital, where she's shooting for her film 'The Ladykiller'. The actress, along with some children from NGO 'SOS Children's Villages of India', also planted saplings in pots that were painted by the children. "This planet is our only home...If we don't keep...[it] safe...we'll not be safe," Bhumi said.

179.title: When I entered stadium, it felt different: CSK's Simarjeet Singh on IPL debut
179.article_body: CSK pacer Simarjeet Singh, who made his IPL debut this season, has revealed that he was "extremely nervous" in his first game against SRH. "When I entered the stadium for the first time, it felt super different," he added. On playing under CSK captain MS Dhoni, Simarjeet said, "I learned how to be calm in pressure situations from Dhoni."

180.title: You did it: Lewandowski to Swiatek after her French Open title win
180.article_body: Taking to Instagram, footballer Robert Lewandowski congratulated Polish Tennis player Iga Swiatek after she won the French Open 2022. "What a match! Congratulations Swiatek, you did it," he wrote. Lewandowski attended the French Open final between Swiatek and Coco Gauff. "Lewandowski's been a top athlete in our country...it's hard to believe that he actually came to watch me," Swiatek stated.

181.title: Tunisian judges to strike for a week after Prez sacks 57 judges
181.article_body: Tunisian judges will hold a week-long strike from Monday and a sit-in protest after the country's President Kais Saied dismissed 57 judges over charges of corruption and protecting terrorists last week. Earlier in February, Saied had also dissolved the Supreme Judicial Council. "The attack was not only against judges, but on the law and freedoms," a judges' association head said.

182.title: RBI may use pics of Rabindranath Tagore, APJ Abdul Kalam on banknotes: Report
182.article_body: In a first, the Finance Ministry and the RBI are considering using watermark figures of Rabindranath Tagore and APJ Abdul Kalam on a new series of banknotes, as per a report. It added that two separate sets of Gandhi, Tagore and Kalam watermarks have been sent to IIT-Delhi Emeritus Professor Dilip T Shahani before a final presentation to the Centre.

183.title: Will summons in name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?: Shiv Sena
183.article_body: After ED summoned Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana' asked, "Will a few summons in the name of Nehru be pasted on his memorial?" "In the National Herald case, the transaction was done to repay the loan and not for misconduct...Nehru started this newspaper in the year 1937," Shiv Sena added.

184.title: Man says 'local guy' plans to kill brother, shares video, Hyd Police respond
184.article_body: A Twitter user shared video of a man indulging in violence and said he is a "local guy" who has plans to kill the user's brother. He also shared screenshot of mail sent to Hyderabad Police officer regarding the matter. "We are suffering, please help us," the user wrote. Hyderabad Police tagged SHO Chaderghat and SHO Malakpet in their reply.

185.title: India's trade deficit widens to $23.33 bn in May, exports rise 15%
185.article_body: India's trade deficit widened to $23.33 billion in May 2022, compared with $6.53 billion recorded in May 2021, as imports grew faster than exports. Merchandise exports rose 15.46% to $37.29 billion while imports grew 56.14% to $60.62 billion. While petroleum and crude oil imports rose 91.6% to $18.14 billion, coal imports rose to $5.33 billion in May 2022.

186.title: This was the first time I did intimate scene in any show: Anuritta on Aashram 3
186.article_body: Actress Anuritta K spoke about the pressure due to her show Ek Badnaam Aashram 3's popularity. "This was the first time I did an intimate scene in any...series," she said. "I feel once the series is popular and your character has received so much love, the responsibility increases. Prakash Jha sir was...clear what he wanted out of me," she added.

187.title: Salman Khan meets world's smallest singer, hugs him in viral video
187.article_body: The world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik posted a video on social media of meeting actor Salman Khan and singing 'Ek Ladki Ko Dekha' for him. Abdu wrote alongside the video, "Jab Salman ko deka to esa laga jese apna koyee (When I saw Salman, it felt like someone my own)." Salman can be seen hugging Abdu in the viral video.

188.title: Australia says Chinese aircraft flew dangerously close to its own
188.article_body: Australia has accused a Chinese fighter aircraft of flying dangerously close to its plane during a routine surveillance activity in May. "The intercept resulted in a dangerous manoeuvre which posed a safety threat," said the government. Defence Minister Richard Marles said that the Chinese jet released a "bundle of chaff" containing aluminium pieces that went into the Australian aircraft's engine.

189.title: Documents link Kanpur violence mastermind with radical groups: Police
189.article_body: Police have come across documents linking the alleged mastermind of the Kanpur violence with radical groups, as per senior police officials. The documents were found with the key accused, including Zafar Hayat Hashmi, when they were arrested. Several people, including policemen, were injured in the clash on Friday.

190.title: 3 killed, 11 injured as multiple gunmen open fire on crowd in US' Philadelphia
190.article_body: Three people were killed and 11 were injured after multiple shooters opened fire into a crowd on a popular Philadelphia street, police said. Police officers were patrolling South Street, an area with many restaurants and bars, when "they observed several active shooters shooting into the crowd," Inspector D.F. Pace of the Philadelphia Police Department said.

191.title: I was sexually abused by family friend for 2.5 years as a teen, says Kubbra Sait
191.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has revealed in her memoir that she was sexually abused by a friend of her parents when she was 17 years old. "I was being sexually abused and no one in my close perimeter could even tell," Sait wrote. She referred to her abuser as 'X' and said the abuse went on for two-and-a-half years.

192.title: 2019 WC final scene recreated as ball deflects off Stokes' bat in Lord's Test, video viral
192.article_body: A video went viral showing the ball deflecting off Ben Stokes' bat at non-striker's end in Lord's Test against New Zealand, with Joe Root imitating Stokes' hands-up reaction from the 2019 World Cup final. Notably, during the 2019 World Cup final, a throw had deflected off Stokes' bat and raced towards boundary when England needed nine runs to win.

193.title: Lego 'freezes' ops in some Russian stores after supply gets hit due to sanctions
193.article_body: Toymaker Lego's Russian reseller has said it is temporarily "freezing" operations at some of its stores in the country after the sanctions imposed on Moscow impacted its supply network. In March, Lego paused shipments to Russia due to disruptions caused by the Ukraine war. The company has 81 stores in Russia, which are operated by Inventive Retail Group.

194.title: Took me 8yrs to get my first Best Actress award: Kriti on IIFA win
194.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon celebrated her IIFA Best Actress award by posting a series of pictures on Instagram, writing, "Dreams do come true...It's taken me 8yrs to get my first #BestActress award." Kriti won the award for 2021 film 'Mimi'. She further wrote, "Will always be grateful to Dinesh Vijan [and] Laxman Utekar sir for making me your Mimi for life."

195.title: We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets vs England: NZ's Daryl
195.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Daryl Mitchell, speaking about the ongoing Test match against England, has said, "We still back ourselves to take 10 wickets." "We'll show up tomorrow morning now with the chance to open up an end and get stuck into their bowlers," he stated. Ahead of Day 4, England need 61 runs to win the match.

196.title: 'Vikram' becomes Kamal Haasan's third film to cross ₹100-crore earnings worldwide
196.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark globally within two days of its release. It has become the third film to cross the ₹100-crore mark globally in Haasan's career after 'Dasavatharam' and 'Vishwaroopam'. The film, which also stars Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya, has been directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj.

197.title: Michael B Jordan, Lori Harvey break up after over 1 year of dating: Reports
197.article_body: Actor Michael B Jordan and model Lori Harvey have broken up after dating for more than a year, as per reports. "Michael and Lori are both completely heartbroken," PEOPLE quoted a source as saying. The couple had celebrated their one-year anniversary in November 2021, months after Jordan made their relationship Instagram official that January.

198.title: IFS officer shares questions from UPSC Preliminary exam, asks people to answer
198.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan shared pictures of questions from UPSC Civil Services Prelim exam and asked people to answer them. What is greenwashing, what is Miyawaki method and which crop is source of methane were among some of the questions shared by Kaswan. He also shared a question which was based on wildlife protection.

199.title: Use brass bottle, wooden brush: Shraddha on World Environment Day
199.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor said everyone should take a pledge to go green and preserve the environment on World Environment Day. She further said we owe a future full of green trees to future generations. "[Use] a brass water bottle instead of a plastic one, a bucket with a mug or a wooden toothbrush instead of a plastic one," Shraddha added.

200.title: 27-yr-old man arrested for stalking ex-classmate in Mumbai: Police
200.article_body: A 27-year-old man was arrested from Mumbai's Khar earlier this week for stalking a woman, police officials said. The woman told the police that the man, who was the woman's classmate in college, had stalked her since 2014. However, the woman filed an FIR against the accused after he approached her twice and even forcibly hugged her last month.

201.title: BJP leader Hans Raj Hans meets Moosewala’s family in Mansa district
201.article_body: BJP leader Hans Raj Hans met the family members of late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala in Mansa district on Sunday. "I have not come here for any political reasons, I have come here as an artist and as a father," Hans said. Moosewala’s parents met Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday in Chandigarh.

202.title: I'd be in Eng's camp because of old ball: Nasser on Day 4 of Lord's Test
202.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain, speaking about the Test match between England and New Zealand, said it has been a new-ball pitch and both teams have struggled against the new ball. He added England will face the old ball on Day 4. "I'd rather be in England's camp because of...old ball, but New Zealand..will be...fighting hard until...last run," he stated.

203.title: Female tennis players should get more prime-time slots: Billie Jean King
203.article_body: Former women's tennis player Billie Jean King has advocated for more prime-time slots for women's tennis in order for the game to get a better audience. "It will stay that way if we don't have more matches (at night)," King said. Notably, only one out of the 10 night matches at this year's French Open was a women's match.

204.title: El Salvador's Arevalo 1st Central American player to win Grand Slam in Paris
204.article_body: El Salvador's Marcelo Arevalo became Central America's first Grand Slam champion on Saturday when he teamed with Netherlands' Jean-Julien Rojer to win French Open men's doubles title. The 12th seeds saved three match points before beating Ivan Dodig and Austin Krajicek 6-7(4-7), 7-6(7-5), 6-3. Notably, the 40-year-old Rojer became the oldest Grand Slam doubles champion in Open Era history.

205.title: B'luru's Baiyappanahalli train terminal to start operations on June 6
205.article_body: Trains will start plying from Baiyappanahalli railway terminal, which is Bengaluru's first fully air-conditioned terminal, from June 6 onwards. It's named after Bharat Ratna recipient Sir M Visvesvaraya and will have seven platforms along with waiting halls, food court, VIP lounge and digital real-time passenger information system. It'll cater to 50,000 passengers commuting in 50 different trains.

206.title: Enough of high-level meetings, Kashmir wants action: Kejriwal
206.article_body: Following targeted killings in Kashmir, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that the era of 1990 has come again. "Whenever there is a murder in the Valley, news comes that the Home Minister has called a high-level meeting, enough of these meetings, now we need action, Kashmir wants action," Kejriwal added. "They (government) don't have any plans," he stated.

207.title: UP farmer falsely framed for 'cow slaughter'; policeman suspended
207.article_body: A 32-year-old farmer, Nawab Ali, in UP's Moradabad was booked and arrested for allegedly taking a cow for slaughter. However, he was released by a court after no evidence was found against him. His wife, Rabia Khatoon, said the police falsely framed him in the case. Sub-inspector Subhash Chandra, who filed the FIR against the man, has been suspended.

208.title: Fire breaks out at Jammu police station, several seized vehicles gutted
208.article_body: At least seven cars and over a dozen two-wheelers seized by police were burnt after a fire broke out on the Satwari police station premises in Jammu on Sunday, officials said. The fire broke out in an open area housing the vehicles after an overhead power line snapped, they added. Four fire engines were rushed to the spot.

209.title: Beer prices surge to £8 per pint for the first time ever in London
209.article_body: The price of a pint of beer has reached £8 (about ₹775) for the first time ever in London amid rising inflation, according to research from industry tracker CGA. Meanwhile, the average price of a pint of beer in UK has increased to £3.95. Beer prices in UK have risen over 70% since the financial crisis of 2008, CGA said.

210.title: Explosion that killed 13 at factory in UP's Hapur caught on CCTV
210.article_body: The explosion at a chemical factory in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur, that killed 13 people, has been captured on a CCTV camera. The footage shows objects flying in the air following the explosion. Smoke and dust were seen filling the air, which reduced the visibility of the surrounding area. At least 20 other persons have sustained injuries in the incident.

211.title: Want Kohli to break Tendulkar's centuries record: Rohit Sharma's coach
211.article_body: Rohit Sharma's childhood coach Dinesh Lad called Virat Kohli a "wonderful batsman" and added that Kohli will make a "strong comeback". "I think it's more about mental strength rather than form. Kohli should concentrate on that. Rest he'll bat well, we can't talk much about that. I want him to break Sachin Tendulkar's century record," he added.

212.title: Actors Prabhas, Yash attend 'KGF' director's b'day party, pics go viral
212.article_body: Actors Prabhas and Yash attended filmmaker Prashanth Neel's birthday party. The pictures of the duo from the party have gone viral on social media. "These are the moments to remember forever," a Twitter user wrote. "Bosses together," another user wrote. Prashanth, who directed Yash's 'KGF' franchise, will direct Prabhas in his upcoming film 'Salaar'.

213.title: People from outside not responsible for Delhi's pollution: Gopal Rai
213.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Sunday said that people from outside "are not responsible for the pollution problem in Delhi" and that Delhi's residents need to cut down their own share of pollution. Delhi government is taking all steps it can to protect the environment but "there's a need to do more", he said and added, "We can improve."

214.title: Maha Metro completes excavation of 12 km tunnel in Pune in 9 months
214.article_body: Maha Metro on Saturday completed the excavation of a 12 km underground tunnel between Swargate and Budhwar Peth in Pune after work began nearly nine months ago. "Due to the technical expertise and sound project management, the tunnelling work has been completed without any hindrance," a metro official said. Pune Metro Rail also shared pictures of the breakthrough on Twitter.

215.title: Supporter prepares 111-ft cake on UP CM Yogi's 50th birthday
215.article_body: A supporter of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Bareilly has prepared a 111-feet cake for his 50th birthday. The cake will weigh 40 quintals and it'll be mounted in phases and supported by 150 quintals of iron structure. The man, Amir Zaidi, will attempt to create a world record with the cake, which will be called 'cake of peace'.

216.title: Kagiso Rabada is a very big threat for Team India in SA T20Is: Irfan
216.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has termed SA pacer Kagiso Rabada as a "very big threat" for Team India in their upcoming T20I series against the Temba Bavuma-led side. "Rabada has regained the form he had lost a little. He is an extremely quality bowler...You can use him like Bumrah is used by the Indian team," added Irfan.

217.title: Won't quit Cong, up to them to throw me out: Sunil Jakhar's nephew
217.article_body: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar's nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar has said that he'll not resign from his post and if Congress wants to "throw [him] out, it's up to them". This comes after Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Sunil to make Sandeep quit as MLA and join BJP. The remark shows Congress leadership's "arrogance", Sandeep added.

218.title: CEC Rajiv Kumar treks 18 km to remote polling booths in U'khand
218.article_body: Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar trekked for 18 kilometres on Friday to the remote polling booths of Uttarakhand to assess the challenges faced by polling parties in hilly areas. Kumar visited Dhumak and Kalgoth, the most remote polling booths of Uttarakhand located in Chamoli. "Polling parties have to walk three days to reach here," Kumar said.

219.title: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis tests COVID-19 positive
219.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday tested positive for coronavirus. "Taking medication and treatment as per doctor's advice," Fadnavis said in a tweet, adding that he is currently under home isolation. "Those who have come in contact with me are advised to get COVID-19 tests done," he further said.

220.title: Putin holds festival honouring rumoured girlfriend Alina amid war, video released
220.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin reportedly held a gymnastic festival honouring his rumoured girlfriend and gymnast Alina Kabaeva, amid the Russian war on Ukraine. The 'Alina Festival', which was reportedly held last month, was aired on Russian state TV on June 1. The broadcast showed young children and gymnasts performing choreographed routines on stage at the festival.

221.title: I'm going to court: Pak singer on Karan Johar's 'Nach Punjaban' song
221.article_body: Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq posted a video on Twitter on Saturday saying that he will sue Karan Johar and T-Series for allegedly stealing his song 'Nach Punjaban' for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. Abrar said merely giving credit is not enough as he never sold his song. "It belongs to me and I'll get it back...I'm coming to the court," he added.

222.title: We denounce insult of religious personalities: BJP after its leader's remarks on Prophet
222.article_body: After violence broke out in Uttar Pradesh over BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, the party released a statement saying, "BJP strongly denounces insult of any religious personalities of any religion." "The BJP is also strongly against any ideology which insults or demeans any sect or religion. The BJP does not promote such people or philosophy," it added.

223.title: I don't party as I sleep by 11 pm, people think I'm uncool: Esha Gupta
223.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta said in an interview that people think she's "uncool" because she doesn't go to parties and sleep by 11 pm. "I'm one of those whose priority isn't partying...I want to wake up early," she added. Esha also spoke about her growth in the industry and said, "It has taken...time to reach where I am as a person."

224.title: Family of brain-dead girl donates heart, saves 14-yr-old Pune boy's life
224.article_body: The family members of a 14-year-old brain-dead girl donated her heart to a boy of the same age suffering from a severe cardiac condition, thereby saving his life. The transplant surgery was carried out at Pune's Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences (AICTS). A green corridor was established for seamless transport of the donor's heart to AICTS within 11 minutes.

225.title: Death toll rises to 13 in UP's Hapur factory blast; 2 booked for culpable homicide
225.article_body: The death toll in factory blast in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur has increased to 13. The owner and director of the factory have been booked for culpable homicide. Police said 33 people were working inside the factory and 20 people who survived have sustained injuries. Police added that what material exploded will be clear after FSL report.

226.title: Dynamic CM: PM Modi on UP CM Yogi Adityanath's 50th birthday
226.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday wished UP CM Yogi Adityanath on his 50th birthday and called him a "dynamic CM". "Under his able leadership, the state has scaled new heights of progress. He has ensured pro-people governance to the people of the state," PM Modi tweeted. "Praying for his long and healthy life in service of the people," he added.

227.title: Shiv Sena to put up MLAs at Mumbai hotel ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
227.article_body: In a bid to avoid poaching, Shiv Sena has asked all its MLAs to stay at a hotel in Mumbai ahead of the Rajya Sabha elections, which will conclude on June 10. The decision was taken "as a precautionary measure", a senior party leader said. "They have been told to come to Mumbai on June 8," the leader added.

228.title: We made an honest film, India has embraced it: Producer Mahesh Babu on Major
228.article_body: Mahesh Babu, who has produced Adivi Sesh-starrer film 'Major', wrote on Twitter, "Thank you for the overwhelming response to #Major." "We made an honest film and India has embraced it...A must watch for every Indian," he added. 'Major' is based on the life of NSG commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, who was martyred in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

229.title: Have to love Trump's branding: Ashneer on 'Biden did that' sticker at US petrol pump
229.article_body: BharatPe's former Managing Director Ashneer Grover took to Twitter to share a picture of 'Biden did that' sticker featuring former US President Donald Trump at a petrol pump in the US. Grover wrote, "Politics is same everywhere...here in US Trump is savvy sticking these things at petrol pumps." He further said, "Have to love Trump's branding."

230.title: Warner, Finch are back, it means I probably won't start: Head on SL ODIs
230.article_body: Australia batter Travis Head has said he probably won't start in their upcoming ODI series against Sri Lanka as David Warner and Aaron Finch are also in the squad. "[We've] also got a middle-order that's so set in that...it's a hard one to get into," he added. Australia will play three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests in Sri Lanka.

231.title: India achieved 10% ethanol blending in petrol target 5 months before deadline: PM
231.article_body: On World Environment Day, PM Narendra Modi announced that India has achieved the target of 10% ethanol blending in petrol five months before the deadline. He added that it has also reduced carbon emissions by 27 lakh tonnes. The ethanol blending programme is aimed at reducing the country's dependence on crude oil imports, cutting carbon emissions and boosting farmers' incomes.

232.title: Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj' sends out message India needs: RSS chief
232.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat attended the special screening of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj'. Speaking about the film, he said, "It is a fact-based movie and rightly sends out the message the country needs today." "We used to read our history written by others. Now, we're looking at history from India's perspective," he added. The film also features Manushi Chhillar.

233.title: 13 cabinet ministers, 8 state ministers take oath in Odisha cabinet reshuffle
233.article_body: As part of cabinet reshuffle in Odisha, 13 cabinet ministers and 8 ministers with independent charge took oath on Sunday in Bhubaneswar in presence of state Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik. BJD MLAs Jagannath Saraka, Niranjan Pujari and R P Swain were among 13 MLAs who were administered oath. Meanwhile, three women legislators have been inducted into cabinet.

234.title: Akshay Kumar's 'Samrat Prithviraj' earns ₹23.3 crore in two days
234.article_body: Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Samrat Prithviraj has earned ₹23.3 crore in its first two days of release. While the film had grossed ₹10.7 crore on Friday, it collected ₹12.6 crore on Saturday. The film, written and directed by Chandraprakash Dwivedi, is based on the life and times of Rajput emperor Prithviraj Chauhan.

235.title: Our anti-aircraft systems are crunching enemy arms like nuts: Putin
235.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said during an interview that the country's anti-aircraft systems are "crunching" enemy weapons "like nuts" and that "dozens have been destroyed". The statement was first reported by the state news agency RIA. This comes as Russia claimed that it had shot down a Ukrainian plane carrying weapons and also struck a "foreign mercenaries" outpost near Odesa.

236.title: SRK graduated from same school: Naukri.com Founder as he shares his school certificate
236.article_body: Naukri.com Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani took to Twitter to share a photo of his character certificate from St Columba's School in New Delhi, dated June 8, 1981. The certificate stated he was "punctual in attendance and diligent in studies". He later went on to reveal that four years later,  actor Shah Rukh Khan too graduated from the same school.

237.title: Sunil Jakhar should make nephew quit as MLA, join BJP: Punjab Cong chief
237.article_body: Punjab Congress chief Amarinder Singh Raja Warring told Indian Express that if BJP leader Sunil Jakhar feels that he is a "big and popular leader", then he should make his nephew and Congress MLA Sandeep Jakhar quit his post and join BJP. However, Warring claimed that Sunil would not do so because he knows that "Sandeep will lose the bypoll".

238.title: BJP leader shares video, claims MLA's son involved in case of minor's gangrape in Hyd
238.article_body: BJP MLA M Raghunandan Rao has shared a video alleging that an AIMIM MLA's son is involved in the case of a minor's gangrape in Hyderabad. Police had said that the MLA's son was not present at the time of the alleged crime. Meanwhile, Inspector S Rajashekhar Reddy said four accused have been arrested while the fifth accused is absconding.

239.title: I want to say something to Ukraine, stay strong: Swiatek after French Open win
239.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek gave a message to war-hit Ukraine in her on-court interview after winning the French Open title. "I want to say something to Ukraine. Stay strong, the world is still there," she stated. The 21-year-old Polish tennis player defeated 18-year-old Coco Gauff in the final with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-3.

240.title: Those protesting against mining should first stop using AC: Chhattisgarh CM
240.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel said those who are trying to politicise mining issue should first stop using electricity and air-conditioner, fan and cooler and then fight for the cause. "Those who are protesting...should first switch off power at their house," he said, adding, "People are claiming 8 lakh trees will be cut...only 8,000 trees will be cut this year."

241.title: Colombian Prez faces house arrest for failing to save national park
241.article_body: A Colombian court sentenced President Ivan Duque to five days' house arrest and imposed a fine of around $4,000 for failing to comply with a Supreme Court order to protect a national park. Duque was held guilty of contempt of court for not taking measures to protect the Los Nevados National Park. He called the order unconstitutional.

242.title: Karthik has to perform against SA to remain in contention for T20 WC: Ravi
242.article_body: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has said that wicket-keeper batter Dinesh Karthik has to perform in his comeback series against South Africa in order to remain in contention for a spot in this year's T20 World Cup. "This is his (Karthik) opportunity...when he gets an opportunity in these games, he has to do it with India colours on," Shastri said.

243.title: Philippines sounds alert after restive volcano spews cloud of ash
243.article_body: The Philippines sounded an alert after a restive volcano at Mount Bulusan spewed a cloud of ash about 1 km into the sky on Sunday. The alert level was raised from zero to one on a five-point scale. According to the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology, 77 volcanic earthquakes were recorded in a 24-hour period before the eruption.

244.title: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur tests positive for COVID-19: Report
244.article_body: Actor Aditya Roy Kapur has reportedly tested positive for COVID-19 and has mild symptoms. According to a report by ETimes, the trailer launch event of his upcoming film 'Om: The Battle Within' has been rescheduled after the actor contracted the virus. The film is scheduled to release on July 1. Earlier, Kartik Aaryan also tested positive for COVID-19.

245.title: Miandad said 'Why are you looking at Audi? You won't get it': Shastri on 1985 WCC final
245.article_body: Recalling 1985 WCC final against Pakistan, Ravi Shastri revealed when India required 15-20 runs to win, Javed Miandad taunted him while he was looking at field setting. "Miandad said, 'Why are you looking at Audi? You aren't...getting it'," Shastri said. He added, "I told him, 'It's coming my way'." Shastri was awarded the car for being player of the tournament.

246.title: Ukraine's Kyiv rocked with multiple explosions, says mayor
246.article_body: Ukraine's Kyiv was rocked by multiple explosions, said Mayor Vitali Klitschko on Sunday. "Several explosions [occurred] in Darnytskyi and Dniprovskyi districts of the capital," Klitschko wrote on the Telegram app. "Services are already working on site. More detailed information - later," he added. This comes a day after Ukraine claimed to have recaptured parts of the Sievierodonetsk city.

247.title: I'm scrambling to get something: Candidate whose job offer Coinbase revoked
247.article_body: Coinbase on Friday extended its hiring freeze and also revoked some accepted job offers. One such candidate, a college graduate, who was supposed to join the company in September, said, "Now I'm scrambling to get something and most companies are either filled up or have frozen hiring." The candidate had passed on three job offers to work for Coinbase.

248.title: Nayanthara, Vignesh meet TN CM Stalin; invite him to their wedding
248.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and director Vignesh Shivan met Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin recently and invited him to their wedding. The duo will reportedly tie the knot on June 9 at a resort in Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu. "It will be low-key in presence of close friends and family members followed by a lavish wedding reception in Chennai," reports stated.

249.title: Lt Col booked for domestic violence in Ambala on complaint of officer wife
249.article_body: Police have booked a Lieutenant Colonel in Ambala for domestic violence and breach of trust on his wife's complaint. According to the complainant, an Army Major, after they got married, she discovered that contrary to his claims, his mother was alive and he had a widowed sister. She also accused him of dowry harassment and beating up their two children.

250.title: Over 12,000 MGNREGA workers resign en masse in Chhattisgarh
250.article_body: Over 12,000 contractual workers of the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) scheme resigned en masse on Saturday in Chhattisgarh. The decision was taken after the state government suddenly terminated the services of 21 MGNREGA  assistant project officers and over the workers' demands, an MGNREGA workers' union leader said. MGNREGA workers were on strike since April.

251.title: Actor Ahan Shetty, son of Suniel Shetty, wins Best Debut Male at IIFA 2022
251.article_body: Actor Ahan Shetty, son of Suniel Shetty, won the Best Debut Male award at the International Indian Film Academy Awards (IIFA) 2022. He won the award for his performance in Milan Luthria's 'Tadap'. Meanwhile, the Best Debut Female award went to Sharvari Wagh for the film 'Bunty Aur Babli 2'. IIFA was held in Abu Dhabi on June 4.

252.title: 4 held for possessing tiger hide, claws in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla
252.article_body: Police arrested four poachers with the help of a tip-off in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla district on Saturday. Notably, the skin of a tiger, its claws and four teeth of a wild boar have been seized by the police. The accused are identified as Makhanlal Yadav (40), Anand Kushram (30), Manoj Pandram (32) and Itwari Posham (27).

253.title: 35 killed, 450 injured in huge fire at container depot in Bangladesh
253.article_body: At least 35 people have died after a huge fire broke out at a shipping container depot in Bangladesh's Chittagong last night. The fire has left about 450 people injured. According to police officer Nurul Alam, a preliminary probe indicated that the fire broke out due to a chemical reaction while local media reported that it spread following an explosion.

254.title: Pooja Hegde joins Deverakonda in Puri Jagannadh's 'JGM'; shooting begins
254.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde is set to share screen space with Vijay Deverakonda in 'JGM', an upcoming film which will be directed by Puri Jagannadh and produced by Charmme Kaur. The film, scheduled to release in theatres on August 3 next year, went on floors on Saturday. 'JGM' will be released in Telugu, Hindi, Tamil, Kannada and Malayalam.

255.title: I don't think there was a need for a break for Rohit: RP Singh
255.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh has said there was no need to rest India captain Rohit Sharma for the upcoming home T20I series against South Africa. "Taking rest or not is his personal thought...But I don't think there was a need...He should have played. It's a long series," stated Singh. The five-match T20I series will begin on June 9.

256.title: Assam Police officer who arrested fiance for fraud held in case related to him
256.article_body: Assam Police officer Junmoni Rabha, who had got her fiance arrested on fraud charges last month, has now been arrested in connection with a case related to him. Reports said that the arrest was made by the Majuli Police on various charges, including criminal conspiracy and cheating. Police interrogated Rabha after her name appeared in FIRs.

257.title: North Korea fires 8 ballistic missiles in 35 minutes: Seoul
257.article_body: North Korea fired at least eight suspected ballistic missiles off its east coast within a span of 35 minutes, the South Korean military said on Sunday. The missiles were launched from the Sunan area in Pyongyang into the East Sea (Sea of Japan), said Seoul's Joint Chiefs of Staff. Japanese Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi said, "This is absolutely unacceptable."

258.title: 5 killed, including 3 children, after car collides with truck in Maharashtra
258.article_body: A car rammed into a stationary truck leading to the death of all five people in the car on the Pune-Bengaluru highway in Maharashtra's Sangli district. The deceased, which included three children, were members of one family. Notably, the deceased were identified as Arinjay Shirote (35), Smita Shirote (38), Purva Shirote (14), Sunesha Shirote (10) and Viru Shirote (4).

259.title: Abhishek Bachchan, Salman Khan spotted together at IIFA Awards 2022, pic goes viral
259.article_body: A picture of actors Abhishek Bachchan and Salman Khan sitting with UAE Minister of Culture, Youth, and Social Development Nahyan bin Mubarak Al Nahyan at the IIFA Awards 2022 has gone viral. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "This is the pic of the year." Meanwhile, another fan called it an "awkward moment".

260.title: Harbhajan Singh names his Team of IPL 2022
260.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has named his Team of IPL 2022. He has included Hardik Pandya as captain. He has named Jos Buttler and KL Rahul as the openers and Dinesh Karthik as the wicketkeeper. Other players include Rahul Tripathi, Liam Livingstone, Andre Russell, Yuzvendra Chahal, Rashid Khan, Umran Malik and Josh Hazlewood.

261.title: Wanted to have a Tennis record but it's hard after Serena's career: Iga
261.article_body: Tennis player Iga Swiatek went past Serena Williams' 34-match unbeaten run after winning the French Open 2022. Iga equalled Venus Williams' record of the 35-match win streak. Speaking about it, she said, "Having that 35th win...doing something more than Serena did, it's...special." "Because I...wanted...to have some kind of a record. In tennis, it's pretty hard after Serena's career," she added.

262.title: I intentionally wanted to hit Sachin to wound him at any cost: Akhtar on 2006 Test
262.article_body: Recalling India-Pakistan 2006 Karachi Test, ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "I'm revealing this for the first time. I intentionally wanted to hit Sachin in that Test." He added, "I was determined that I had to wound Sachin in that Test at any cost." He added he hit Sachin's helmet once, but, Sachin managed to save his head.

263.title: Ukraine minister criticises Macron's 'don't humiliate' Russia call
263.article_body: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Sunday reacted to French President Emmanuel Macron's warning against "humiliating" Russia, saying, "Calls to avoid humiliation of Russia can only humiliate France and every other country that'd call for it." Macron had said that this should be done for post-war diplomatic efforts. "We...better focus on how to put Russia in its place," Kuleba added.

264.title: Kashmir is burning but important people of Delhi promoting films: Raut
264.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that Kashmir is "burning" again and the situation there is out of control. "Important people of Delhi (central government) are busy promoting films," Raut added. "No one is willing to listen to the Kashmiris. The Kashmiri Pandits are forced to agitate, what is the government doing?" Raut asked.

265.title: Man given life imprisonment ’till last breath’ in murder case in Gurgaon
265.article_body: A man, Nofil Anwar, was sentenced to life imprisonment "till last breath" by a Gurgaon Court for stabbing a security guard and killing him in a private hospital in 2019. "If...awarded...simply life imprisonment...he...will be released from custody after 14 years...but...such culprit is required to be kept behind the bars till the end of his life," court said.

266.title: Delhi minister scolds officials over lack of AC for public; video surfaces
266.article_body: A video of Delhi minister Kailash Gahlot scolding officials over the lack of AC for public at a government office in the national capital has surfaced online. "Should we get the ACs removed in your rooms?" he questioned the officials. Furthermore, Gahlot reacted to the incident, saying, "[Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal] says that it's our duty to provide facilities to...public."

267.title: Ronaldo wins Man United's Player of the Year award for record-equalling 4th time
267.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has won the Manchester United's Sir Matt Busby Player of the Year award for a record-equalling fourth time in his career. David de Gea is the only other United player who has won the award four times. Ronaldo scored 24 goals across competitions in the 2021-22 season, finishing only behind Son Heung-min and Mohamed Salah in Premier League.

268.title: Raghav Chadha says 'Send officers to tribal affairs as punishment posting'; criticised
268.article_body: In an interview, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "You can't fire government officials. You can only transfer them. If someone is working very well, you'll give them a good department...And if someone is doing a bad job, send them to tribal affairs as punishment posting." "I'm ashamed that I ever saw hope in youngsters like Raghav Chadha," said Yogendra Yadav.

269.title: Led by RIL, 4 of top 10 valued firms add ₹2.31 lakh cr in m-cap in past week
269.article_body: Four of the top 10 most valued domestic firms together added ₹2,31,320.37 crore in market valuation in the past week. While Reliance Industries contributed the most with a valuation jump of ₹1,38,222.46 crore to ₹18,80,350.47 crore, it was followed by TCS whose valuation zoomed by ₹64,618.85 crore to ₹12,58,274.59 crore. Infosys and ICICI Bank were the other gainers.

270.title: Tip of iceberg: Former CM as 4 ex-Punjab Cong ministers join BJP
270.article_body: After four former Punjab Congress ministers joined BJP on Saturday, ex-Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said, "This is just the tip of the iceberg!" His remark came as Balbir Singh Sidhu, Raj Kumar Verka, Sunder Sham Arora and Gurpreet Singh Kangar joined the BJP in Chandigarh in Union Home Minister Amit Shah’s presence, yesterday.

271.title: 1 killed, 7 injured in shooting at graduation party in US
271.article_body: A 20-year-old man was killed and seven others, aged from 16 to 21 years, were injured in a shooting that took place at a graduation party in US' Virginia, said police. The police recovered over 50 casings of four different calibers. "Whether that means it was four people shooting, I can't tell you that," said a police official.

272.title: Pak security forces on alert amid rumours of Imran's murder plot
272.article_body: The security agencies in Pakistan's Islamabad have reportedly been put on high alert amid rumours of assassination plot against former PM Imran Khan. Khan is expected to arrive in Bani Gala, a residential area located in the capital, on Sunday. Section 144 has been imposed in Islamabad and gatherings have been banned, according to police.

273.title: Over 40,000 motorists penalised in a special drive in Mumbai on Friday
273.article_body: In a special drive conducted by the Mumbai Traffic Police on Friday, around 40,320 motorists were penalised in the city for violating traffic rules. Out of 40,320 motorists, 9,847 were penalised for no parking while 3,310 were fined for honking, police said. Notably, a total of 1,842 police personnel were deployed to conduct the special drive.

274.title: Police gets access to CCTV footage in Delhi metro sexual harassment case
274.article_body: After a woman took to Twitter to share an incident of sexual harassment that took place with her at Delhi's Jor Bagh metro station, Delhi Metro authorities have said that they have shared the CCTV footage of the incident with the Delhi Police. The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has also said that they have zero tolerance toward such incidents.

275.title: How many people thought this was okay: Priyanka on body spray ads having gang rape jokes
275.article_body: Reacting to deodorant advertisements by Layer'r Shot which were accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape, Priyanka Chopra tweeted, "Shameful and disgusting. How many levels of clearances did it take for this commercial to be green lit?" She added, "How many people thought this was ok? I’m so glad...it was called out and...the ministry has taken it down. Appalling!"

276.title: Traffic police officer slaps Swiggy delivery agent in viral video in TN, transferred
276.article_body: A traffic police officer in Tamil Nadu was transferred after he was caught on camera slapping a Swiggy delivery agent. The agent was questioning the driver of a school bus who was driving rash and was about to hit a pedestrian, which led to a traffic jam. The policeman also snatched the delivery agent's phone and damaged his motorcycle.

277.title: Hours after party brawl, IPS officer removed as Dwarka DCP
277.article_body: Hours after IPS officer Shankar Choudhary was accused of hitting a woman with a glass at a birthday party in Delhi, he was "relieved from his duty as DCP (Dwarka)". The Police PRO, however, did not say if the order, which was issued by the Delhi Police Commissioner, was related to the party brawl.

278.title: I feel like her blood is still on me: Teacher on Hindu colleague shot dead in J&K
278.article_body: Remembering late Rajni Bala, the 36-year-old Hindu school teacher shot dead by terrorists in Kashmir recently, her colleague Shahida Maqbool said, "I feel like her blood is still on me." Another teacher Saima Akhtar said, "She had been shot in the head. I tied her own dupatta around the wound trying to stop the blood while I screamed for help."

279.title: Dream come true to be on screen with you: Suriya to 'Vikram' co-star Haasan
279.article_body: Actor Suriya, who plays a cameo role in Kamal Haasan and Lokesh Kanagaraj's film 'Vikram', wrote on Twitter, "Dearest Kamal Haasan Anna...This is a dream come true to be on screen with you..!" "Thank you for making this happen! Overwhelmed to see all the love," he added. The action thriller film also stars Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil.

280.title: Burning people jumped into drains for water contact: Hapur fire witness
280.article_body: Shyam Sundar, a man who works near the factory where fire broke out in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur, said there were people bleeding and burning and running out of factory. "[They were] jumping in drains...hoping for some contact with water," Sundar said. Another man who works near the factory injured his arm as material reportedly came flying out of the factory.

281.title: England lose to Hungary for 1st time in 60 years
281.article_body: England lost 0-1 to Hungary in their UEFA Nations League opener as Hungary's Dominik Szoboszlai converted a penalty after being fouled by Reece James. Notably, this is the first time in 60 years that Hungary have beaten England. "We have to accept that we did not do enough to win the game," said England coach Gareth Southgate.

282.title: Novak Djokovic is absolute favourite at Wimbledon: Djokovic's coach
282.article_body: Tennis player Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic has said that the Serbian player must rest well and prepare "physically and mentally" for Wimbledon 2022.  "Djokovic is the absolute favourite at Wimbledon, as is Rafael Nadal here," Goran stated. "I'm sure he can do it and I think he [Djokovic] will win it, I have a good feeling," he added.

283.title: Bicycles left by migrant workers during lockdown auctioned for ₹21.2 lakh in UP
283.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur district administration has auctioned 5,400 bicycles left behind by migrant workers while they rushed home during the COVID-19 lockdown, said a senior official. A total of ₹21.2 lakh was collected, said the SDM. The SDM added that while 14,600 labourers collected their bicycles from Saharanpur, 5,400 bicycles were getting rusted over the past two years.

284.title: Satyendar Jain can't have lawyer during ED questioning: Delhi HC
284.article_body: The Delhi High Court stayed a trial court order that allowed Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain to have his lawyer present during the questioning by ED in a money laundering case. The HC noted that since there is no FIR against Jain and he has only been called for questioning, he cannot claim the right to have his lawyer present.

285.title: I don't take it as pressure: Saiee Manjrekar on being a star kid
285.article_body: Actress Saiee Manjrekar, speaking about the pressure of being a star kid, has said, "I don't take it as pressure. Instead, it's more like motivation to put in more efforts." However, Saiee added that she should make her father Mahesh Manjrekar proud in "every step of the way". Saiee made her Bollywood debut in Salman Khan-starrer 'Dabangg 3'.

286.title: Not necessary to meet him every time: Chavan on 'haven’t met Rahul in 4 yrs'
286.article_body: Ex-Maharashtra CM and Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan has issued a clarification over his remark "haven’t met Rahul Gandhi in the last four years." "He had resigned from his post in the organisation…He’s opposing PM Narendra Modi in his own way and going across the nation and abroad. Not necessary to meet him every time," the Congress G-23 group member added.

287.title: Curfew imposed in Bareilly till July 3 after violence in UP's Kanpur
287.article_body: After clashes broke out between two groups in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur on Friday, curfew under section 144 has been imposed in Bareilly till July 3. The decision comes after call for protest to be held on June 10 as announced by Muslim cleric Tauqeer Raza. Administration said not more than five people will be allowed to assemble in public place.

288.title: Doctors treat patients using phone light due to power cut in Bihar
288.article_body: Doctors at Sadar Hospital in Bihar's Rohtas used the light from their phones to treat critical patients due to a sudden power outage, a civil surgeon said. The civil surgeon added that the incident took place on Friday night. District Magistrate Dharmendra Kumar said that following complaints, a show-cause notice was issued with directions to solve the problems immediately.

289.title: Man kills 22-yr-old live-in partner on suspicion of cheating in Gurugram
289.article_body: A 25-year-old man, identified as Rahul, stabbed his 22-year-old live-in partner to death using a kitchen knife on suspicion of cheating in Gurugram, said police. He then called the police to inform about the murder, following which he was arrested. The woman had reportedly separated from her husband three years ago and soon started living with Rahul.

290.title: Vlogger Roddur Roy abuses Mamata Banerjee over KK's last concert, police case filed
290.article_body: A case has been filed against vlogger Roddur Roy for abusing West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee in a Facebook Live over late singer KK's last concert. Roddur used expletives as he blamed the ruling party, alleging mismanagement at singer KK's last concert in Nazrul Mancha. KK passed away aged 53 due to a suspected cardiac arrest after the concert.

291.title: India reports 4,270 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases rise to 24,052
291.article_body: India has reported 4,270 COVID-19 cases, 2,619 recoveries and 15 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,962 COVID-19 cases and 26 deaths. Active cases in India increased to 24,052, while the death toll reached 5,24,692.

292.title: It shouldn't have happened, there was no need: Harbhajan on slapping Sreesanth in 2008
292.article_body: Talking about slapping Sreesanth in IPL 2008, Harbhajan Singh said, "What happened was wrong. I made a mistake. Because of me, he had to face embarrassment. I was embarrassed." He added, "If I had to correct one mistake...it was how I treated Sreesanth. It shouldn't have happened. When I think about it...I feel there was no need," Harbhajan said.

293.title: Abbott resumes production at Michigan plant amid shortage of baby formula in US
293.article_body: Abbott is restarting baby formula production at its Michigan plant after its shutdown led to a shortage of baby food in the US. The Michigan plant, one of America's largest, was closed in February after reports of bacterial contamination found in its formula products. The company said that the facility met initial government sanitary requirements for reopening.

294.title: Was heartbreaking: Tiger Shroff on Heropanti 2's box office failure
294.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff said that the box office failure of his film 'Heropanti 2' was "definitely heartbreaking". "I'm extremely connected to all my movies. So it takes a toll on me every time if a film doesn't work. I bounce back by immersing myself in work," he added. Tiger will next be seen in 'Ganapath' and 'Bade Miyan Chote Miyan'.

295.title: Feeling very dull after Sidhu Moosewala, KK's deaths: Amit Sadh
295.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has said he has been feeling "very dull" after the deaths of Sidhu Moosewala and KK. "Of course, we have to live life, move on and be happy. But, at this time, I'm just a little troubled with what's been going around," he added. On being asked about his favourite song sung by KK, Amit named 'Pal'.

296.title: I've got really good feeling about it: Broad on winning prospects vs NZ on Day 4
296.article_body: With England needing 61 runs to win the ongoing Test against New Zealand at Lord's on Day 4, England pacer Stuart Broad said he's got a "really good feeling about [it]". NZ were restricted to 285 in their second innings after they lost their last six wickets for 34 runs. England's Joe Root is unbeaten at the crease at 77*(131).

297.title: 13-yr-old boy has surgery in Delhi, regains ability to eat, speak after 7 yrs
297.article_body: A 13-year-old boy from Rajasthan regained his ability to speak, eat food, and breathe on his own after he had surgery in Delhi. Reports said during surgery, doctors removed a breathing pipe that had been placed in his airway seven years ago. The boy had fell off a roof and was in coma for two weeks, when pipe was placed.

298.title: Bengaluru police clear traffic jam after person raises complaint
298.article_body: Bengaluru's Madivala Traffic Police Station on Sunday shared a picture and tweeted that traffic jam, caused due to an accident and rain, at Roopena Agrahara was cleared following a complaint by a person from a news agency. The person tweeted that "haphazardly parked" private buses were causing the traffic jam. The person also tagged the city's Police Commissioner in tweet.

299.title: Was going to ask if you're Anupam Kher: Driver to actor taking ride in his auto
299.article_body: An autorickshaw driver told actor Anupam Kher that he was going to ask him if he was the actor while Kher took a ride in his autorickshaw after morning walk. In a video shared by Kher, the actor can be seen asking the driver's name. He can also be seen meeting kids at traffic signal and giving sweets to them.

300.title: 1st ever population study of dolphins around Mumbai coast gets commissioned
300.article_body: The Maharashtra forest department's Mangrove Foundation is going to conduct the first-ever dolphin population estimation exercise across coastal waters of the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. The decision was taken after it was revealed in a study that South Mumbai's Backbay area resulted in 27 sightings of Indian Ocean humpback dolphins. Notably, the study will begin post-monsoon, an official said.

301.title: Policeman injured after 2 car thieves attack with knife in Pune
301.article_body: A policeman was allegedly injured in a knife attack by two thieves who were trying to escape with a stolen car in Pune on Friday. The police were chasing the thieves after a complaint by the car owner. When they tried to stop the perpetrators, they were attacked. Taking advantage of darkness, the thieves dropped their weapons and ran away.

302.title: Actor Adivi Sesh does his magic once again: Allu Arjun on 'Major'
302.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Allu Arjun praised Adivi Sesh-starrer 'Major'. "A very heart-touching film. Man of the show Adivi does his magic once again," he stated." "Big congratulations and my personal respect to the producer Mahesh Babu for giving the audience such a heartwarming experience...Major: A story that touches every Indian heart," Allu further tweeted.

303.title: Maharashtra will do whatever is possible for Kashmiri Pandits: CM
303.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that his government will do whatever is possible for Kashmiri Pandits. "We will not leave them in the lurch," Thackeray added. "Maharashtra will stand firmly with them," he stated. Meanwhile, Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray, CM’s son, said that the situation in Kashmir is "deeply concerning".

304.title: PMC starts drive to give away saplings at ₹5 on World Environment Day
304.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is starting a drive on Sunday, on the occasion of World Environment Day, to give away native saplings like Jamun, Ashoka, Neem etc at a minimal cost of ₹5. A 'Van Mahotsav' has been organised at Sambhaji Raje Udyan. With an aim to distribute 80,000 saplings, the drive will continue till August 15.

305.title: Mercedes to recall 1 million older cars worldwide over possible faulty brakes
305.article_body: Mercedes-Benz is recalling nearly a million older cars worldwide due to a possible problem with the braking system, said the company on Saturday. It added that models of the ML, GL (BR 164) and R-Class (BR 251) series produced between 2004 and 2015 will be affected. As per the federal transport authority, worldwide 9,93,407 vehicles were being recalled.

306.title: Residents face 11-hour power outage in Pune's Sadashiv Peth
306.article_body: Residents in Pune's Sadashiv Peth on Saturday faced an 11-hour power outage in the area from 10 am. A Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) official said that the power cut was due to multiple faults in the cables amid digging in the area. Due to the power cut, offices were also unable to function.

307.title: Who won what at IIFA awards 2022?
307.article_body: Vicky Kaushal was named the Best Actor at IIFA awards 2022 for his role in 'Sardar Udham', while Kriti Sanon bagged the Best Actress award for her role in 'Mimi'. 'Shershaah' was named Best Film, while 'Shershaah' director Vishnuvaradhan bagged the Best Director award. Sai Tamhankar and Pankaj Tripathi won the Best Supporting Actress and Best Supporting Actor awards, respectively.

308.title: US President Biden evacuated from beach home after plane enters restricted airspace
308.article_body: A small private airplane mistakenly entered restricted airspace near US President Joe Biden's Delaware beach home on Saturday, prompting the brief evacuation of the President and the First Lady. The White House said there was no threat to Biden or his family and that precautionary measures were taken. After the situation was assessed, they returned to the beach home.

309.title: Big B shared TVF video; we took screenshots & shared on our group: Jitendra
309.article_body: Actor Jitendra Kumar recalled that actor Amitabh Bachchan once shared a sketch video made by TVF on Twitter. Jitendra said that the team members took screenshots of Bachchan sharing video and shared it on their group. "That's when we realised this could be a series," he said, adding, "Gajraj [Rao] sir killed it in the sketch and it went viral."

310.title: Tesla headcount will increase, salaried to be fairly flat: Musk after job cuts email
310.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted that the company's total headcount would increase over the next 12 months but the salaried staff "should be fairly flat". Musk was replying to a Twitter user who said Tesla's headcount would increase over the next year. His tweet comes days after he reportedly emailed his staff about 10% job cuts at Tesla.

311.title: Gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's bail plea rejected
311.article_body: A local court in Lucknow rejected gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari's bail plea in connection with a 2020 land grab case. Special Judge Gaurav Kumar said, "The possibility that he would influence the witnesses during the trial cannot be ruled out." Ansari's bail application claimed that he was innocent and was implicated in the case due to political rivalry.

312.title: 17th-century monastery hit by Russian artillery in Ukraine: Prez
312.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian artillery had hit a 17th-century Ukrainian Orthodox monastery in eastern Ukraine on Saturday, engulfing a church in flames. However, Russia has denied any involvement in the incident and accused the Ukrainian troops of setting the church on fire before pulling back. Ukraine has repeatedly accused Russia of targeting civilians amid the war.

313.title: Simply amazing: Alcaraz to Swiatek after her French Open title win
313.article_body: Reacting to world number one Iga Swiatek's 2022 French Open title win, world number six men's tennis player Carlos Alcaraz congratulated her, saying, "Simply amazing." World number six Ons Jabeur, who lost in the first round of women's singles at the French Open, tweeted, "Congrats Swiatek, incredible really." Notably, it is Swiatek's sixth consecutive title in 2022.

314.title: Situation in Kashmir is deeply concerning: Aaditya Thackeray
314.article_body: Speaking about the recent killings in Kashmir, Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray called the situation in the valley "deeply concerning". He said, "It is unfortunate that the situation is repeating in these times again. We expect the Government of India to take strong measures to ensure their protection." Kashmir has reportedly witnessed at least eight killings since May 1, 2022.

315.title: Rare natural pearl necklace sold for ₹6.25 cr at online auction, pic released
315.article_body: A rare natural pearl necklace has been auctioned for ₹6.25 crore at an AstaGuru online auction. The necklace, which was part of the Mumbai-based auction house's 'Heirloom Jewellery, Silver, and Timepieces' collection, has natural, salt-water pearls, faceted crystal discs and a golden clasp set with old cut diamonds. It's said to be an extremely rare find due to its size.

316.title: Mahindra shares pic of his father's 77-year-old application to US college
316.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared pictures of his father Harish Mahindra's application to Tufts University's The Fletcher School in 1945. "So proud to read my father's audacious aspiration and bold statement while India was still a British colony," he wrote. In the application, his father had written why he had chosen Foreign Service as his professional aim.

317.title: I've torn several lateral ligaments in my right foot: World no. 3 Zverev
317.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev took to Instagram to give an update on his ankle injury, which forced him to withdraw from 2022 French Open semi-final against Rafael Nadal. "Based on the first medical checks, it looks like I've torn several lateral ligaments in my right foot. I'll be flying to Germany on Monday to make further examinations."

318.title: Cong doesn't recognise workers: Punjab ex-minister on joining BJP
318.article_body: Former Punjab minister Balbir Singh Sidhu criticised Congress after he joined BJP and said Congress does not 'recognise its workers'. "I have been in Congress since I was 30-32 years old...(I've) worked with all my blood and sweat for the party," he said. Sidhu, along with three former Congress ministers and two SAD leaders joined BJP on Saturday.

319.title: US & S Korea conclude military drills amid tensions with N Korea
319.article_body: South Korea and the US concluded a three-day military exercise on Saturday, amid tensions with North Korea. Notably, this the first combined exercise between the two countries involving an American aircraft carrier in over four years. The tensions stem from the recent missile launches by North Korea and reports of the North Korean government preparing to conduct a nuclear test.

320.title: Beautifully won: Poland's Hurkacz on compatriot Swiatek's French Open title
320.article_body: Congratulating compatriot Iga Swiatek on her second Grand Slam win at French Open 2022, Poland's Hubert Hurkacz tweeted, "Beautifully won." Australian Open tweeted, "Making it reign. Iga becomes the youngest multiple major winner since Maria Sharapova in 2006." Swiatek has now matched Venus Williams' streak of 35 straight match wins, which is longest unbeaten run in women's tennis this century.

321.title: India's fighting spirit will be there despite Rohit, Kohli's absence: Bavuma
321.article_body: South Africa limited-overs captain Temba Bavuma said the Indian team's fighting spirit will still be there despite Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's absence from India's squad in upcoming T20I series against his side, beginning June 9. India have rested some of their senior players like regular captain Rohit, Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah. KL Rahul has been appointed as captain.

322.title: Expect 1.5 lakh migrants to arrive this year: 5 European nations
322.article_body: Over 1.5 lakh migrants are expected to arrive in Italy, Spain, Greece, Cyprus and Malta this year, Cyprus' Interior Minister Nicos Nouris said. Nouris' comment comes after a meeting with the fellow ministers of the countries. Notably, about 36,400 asylum seekers and migrants have already arrived in the five Mediterranean countries this year, according to the UN refugee agency.

323.title: Woman gives birth to son in Pacific Ocean without any medical assistance, video viral
323.article_body: A woman has shared a video of herself giving birth to her son in the Pacific Ocean. Josy Peukert, 37, delivered her son on the shoreline of Playa Majagual in Nicaragua. She delivered her baby without medical assistance, turning down scans throughout her pregnancy. "I did all the research I needed to make sure it was safe," she said.

324.title: 3 minors booked for sodomising, beating up 7-year-old boy in Bihar
324.article_body: Three minors, aged between 11 and 13, have been booked for allegedly sodomising a seven-year-old boy in Bihar's Bhojpur district. The incident took place during a local social gathering, when the three accused allegedly gagged the boy and forcibly took him to a nearby field. The boy was also allegedly beaten up and threatened during the entire incident.

325.title: Divya once didn't get out of car over fear of getting scolded: Producer
325.article_body: Guddu Dhanoa, who produced 1992 film 'Deewana', revealed that late actress Divya Bharti once refused to get out of her car because she was "frightened" of getting scolded. He added that she was afraid the producer would scold her for coming a little late. "She got off only after I assured her we were not mad at her," Guddu said.

326.title: 13-year-old gangrape victim dies during treatment in UP
326.article_body: A 13-year-old Dalit girl, who was allegedly gangraped in Uttar Pradesh's Chitrakoot district, died during treatment, police said, adding three men have been arrested in the case. The girl was allegedly gang-raped on Wednesday night when she was sleeping with her family outside her house, Superintendent of Police Atul Sharma said. She succumbed to the injuries on Thursday, police added.

327.title: Heart-wrenching: PM Modi as 9 killed in UP boiler explosion
327.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences after nine workers died in a boiler blast in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur and called the incident "heart-wrenching". "I express my condolences to the families of those who lost their lives," he said. At least nine workers were killed and 19 others were injured after a boiler exploded at a factory in Hapur on Saturday.

328.title: Didn't do much: Vijayendra on Ranbir saying he added to 'Brahmāstra'
328.article_body: SS Rajamouli's father writer Vijayendra Prasad has reacted to actor Ranbir Kapoor saying that the former added considerably to upcoming film 'Brahmāstra'. He said, "I have not done anything much...I've just tightened some nuts and bolts, that's all." Ranbir had earlier said that director Ayan Mukerji made the 'Brahmāstra' team reshoot for four days following Vijayendra's suggestions.

329.title: No point in talks until Russian troops pushed back: Ukraine
329.article_body: Ukraine has said that there was no point in negotiating with Russia until the Russian forces were pushed back as far as possible. This comes after French President Emmanuel Macron's call not to "humiliate" Russia for the sake of diplomacy. Earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy had said that the Russian forces occupied about 20% of Ukraine's territory.

330.title: Pressure was big this time: World no. 1 Swiatek on 2nd French Open win
330.article_body: After winning French Open title for the second time on Saturday, world number one Iga Swiatek said the "pressure was big" and it was "tough" this time. "Two years ago winning this was something amazing. This time I feel I worked hard to get here," she stated. Swiatek defeated 18th seed Coco Gauff 6-1, 6-3 for her 35th consecutive win.

331.title: Cong should see why experienced leaders are leaving: Sunil Jakhar
331.article_body: BJP leader Sunil Jakhar criticised Congress and said the party "should see why such experienced leaders and workers are leaving the party". "If they can't pledge their allegiance to the country and remove the drawbacks of the party, they might even lose the status of being an Opposition," Jakhar said. His comment comes after six Punjab Congress leaders joined BJP.

332.title: 3 people from MP arrested in Odisha with 45 kg marijuana
332.article_body: Three people from Madhya Pradesh were arrested with 45 kg marijuana worth ₹2.25 lakh in Odisha's Jharsuguda station, the railways said. The seizure was made during the "operation Narcos" drive, railways added. The accused were apprehended when they were entering the station in a hurry to catch a Delhi-bound train and upon searching, the drugs were found, it said.

333.title: Next CM will be from NCP: Maharashtra Minister Dhananjay Munde
333.article_body: Maharashtra Social Justice Minister Dhananjay Munde said, "Next CM will be from NCP and I will continue to hold the Social Justice Department." "NCP chief...made me the Leader of Opposition in state council between 2014 and 2019...and I [did[ justice to the post," he added. Supriya Sule earlier said, "Let the next CM of Maharashtra be from NCP."

334.title: Video of Chinese missile nearly hitting a passenger plane goes viral
334.article_body: A video showing a Chinese ballistic missile narrowly missing a passenger plane flying over the South China Sea has gone viral online. Pilots of the Boeing 777 operated by Cathay Pacific Airline reportedly avoided a mishap after getting a last-minute call from air traffic control asking them to 'turn left 90 degrees immediately!' The incident reportedly occurred in May.

335.title: Incredible win: Billie Jean King on Swiatek's French Open victory
335.article_body: Following Iga Swiatek's second French Open title, 12-time Grand Slam champion Billie Jean King took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations, Swiatek, on another incredible win!" The world number one beat 18th seed Coco Gauff 6-1, 6-3 in final. Overall, it's the 21-year-old's second Grand Slam title. Notably, Swiatek is 10th woman to win multiple Roland Garros titles in Open Era.

336.title: It's seen its wait due to inevitable issues: SRK shares 'Jawan' poster
336.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to social media to share the poster of his upcoming film 'Jawan' on Saturday. He wrote alongside the poster, "It's a special...project that has seen its wait because of inevitable issues surrounding us. But a few good men worked hard & made it happen...Now...Good to go Chief...!" He was last seen in 2018 film 'Zero'.

337.title: Had Yuvraj been India captain we would've to wake up, sleep early: Harbhajan
337.article_body: Talking about Yuvraj Singh, Harbhajan Singh said had the 40-year-old been India captain then everyone in the team would have had to sleep and wake up early (laughs). "He would've been a great captain. His records speak for themselves as he won the 'Player of the Tournament' in the 2011 World Cup, a title that gives us respect," he added.

338.title: Madhya Pradesh issues chickenpox advisory after detecting 31 cases
338.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Health Department on Saturday issued a health advisory after 31 chickenpox cases were reported in the state over the past month, Health Commissioner-cum-Secretary Sudam Khade said. The advisory is regarding prevention and treatment of chickenpox, Khade added. The cases were detected in Chhatarpur, Chhindwara, Datia, Neemuch, Bhopal, Dhar and Khandwa districts, Khade further said.

339.title: Mumbai reports 889 new COVID-19 cases, highest since January 31
339.article_body: Mumbai has recorded 889 cases of COVID-19 and one death related to the infection in the last 24 hours. As per reports, the number of cases reported is the highest recorded since January 31. The number of active COVID-19 patients in the city stands at 4,294, while 45 patients were hospitalised in the last 24 hours.

340.title: Nigerian rapper Burna Boy breaks down as he pays tribute to Moosewala on stage
340.article_body: Nigerian rapper Burna Boy broke down during his recent gig in Zimbabwe as he paid tribute to late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead by assailants on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced online, Burna Boy is seen mentioning 'RIP Sidhu Moosewala' while performing the late singer's signature step. He is seen getting emotional in the video.

341.title: It was creating division, rancour: Google on cancelling US Dalit activist's talk
341.article_body: Google issued a statement after it was criticised for cancelling US-based Dalit rights activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan's scheduled talk on caste bias to Google News employees. Google said the talk "was creating division and rancour", instead of bringing the community together and raising awareness. It also denied caste discrimination charges and said, "[It] has no place in our workplace."

342.title: I'd love to be part of larger-than-life costume drama: Yami
342.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has stated in an interview that she would love to be a part of a "costume drama" in a "larger-than-life fantasy film". She added that it could be a biopic, a comedy or a thriller but the character has to be interesting too. "As an actor, there shouldn't be a set template," the actress said.

343.title: 5 planets to align in order in June, to be visible with naked eye
343.article_body: For the first time in nearly 18 years, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn  will be sequentially aligned and visible at dawn throughout this month. The first dates of note were June 3 and 4, and the next is June 24. Mercury will be easier to spot on this morning and the parade will be joined by a crescent Moon.

344.title: 'Assam CM gave PPE contracts to his wife's firm', says Delhi Dy CM; he responds
344.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has alleged that Assam CM Himanta Sarma gave contracts for PPE kits to firms owned by his wife and his son's business associates. He alleged Assam government bought PPE kits at inflated prices from these firms. Sarma refuted these allegations saying his wife donated free PPE kits. "You'll face criminal defamation," said Sarma to Sisodia.

345.title: Govt wants to get me killed to break Tikait family: Rakesh Tikait
345.article_body: Bhartiya Kisan Union (BKU) leader Rakesh Tikait has alleged that the government "wants to get him killed to break the Tikait family". Tikait termed the recent ink attack on him in Bengaluru a "well-planned conspiracy".  "People who raise their voices for the country and the farmers of the country are on the target of the conspirators," the farmer leader said.

346.title: His talks will be taught in classes: Paytm CEO on Jaishankar's remark on Europe
346.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma has praised External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar, after the latter said, "Europe has to grow out of the mindset that Europe's problems are the world's problems but the world's problems are not Europe's problems." Sharing a video of Jaishankar's response, Sharma wrote, "I am sure his conversations one day will be taught in classrooms."

347.title: Russian air activity remains high over Ukraine's Donbas: UK
347.article_body: The UK's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that Russia's air activity remains high over Ukraine's Donbas region with Russian aircraft carrying out strikes using both guided and unguided munitions. "The increased use of unguided munitions has led to the widespread destruction of built-up areas...and has almost certainly caused substantial collateral damage and civilian casualties," it added.

348.title: Does everyone think rape is a joke: Richa on Layer'r Shot's ads
348.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha has reacted to the Layer'r Shot ads accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape. She tweeted, "This ad is not an accident...DOES EVERYONE THINK RAPE IS A JOKE? Revelatory! This brand, the agency that made this ad need to be sued for the filth they're serving." DCW chief Swati Maliwal said it "blatantly promotes rape mentality".

349.title: Saw a few games of Nadal-Djokovic: Sharapova on watching French Open 2022
349.article_body: During a Q&A session on Instagram, five-time Grand Slam champion Maria Sharapova was asked if she was watching the 2022 French Open, to which she replied, "I watched a few games of Rafael Nadal-Novak Djokovic." She added, "[I] don't have cable so caught it on Tennis Channel's feed." Nadal defeated Djokovic 6-2, 4-6, 6-2, 7-6(7-4) in the quarter-final.

350.title: World number one Swiatek defeats 18-year-old Gauff to win her second French Open title
350.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek defeated 18-year-old Coco Gauff in the 2022 Roland Garros women's singles final to win her second French Open title. The 21-year-old Polish tennis player won the match with a scoreline of 6-1, 6-3. With the win, Swiatek also extended her winning streak to 35 matches. Swiatek had won her maiden French Open title in 2020.

351.title: I spend ₹25 lakh every month to feed 5,000 people: Gambhir on why he works in IPL
351.article_body: Talking about why he works in IPL, LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said, "It is because I spend ₹25 lakh every month to feed 5,000 people."
