He added, "I spend all of this money from my own pocket and not from the MPLADS fund. The MPLADS fund doesn’t run my kitchen or other things that I do."

352.title: UK Police briefly evacuates Trafalgar Square over suspicious car
352.article_body: The police in the UK on Saturday briefly evacuated London's Trafalgar Square over a suspicious car at the tourist hotspot. The police said that they had carried out a controlled explosion while investigating the vehicle. "This was investigated and after police took action we have no further concern. This was not terrorism-related," they added.

353.title: Video shows UP woman being thrashed by in-laws for not giving birth to son
353.article_body: A video has surfaced online, showing a woman being allegedly thrashed publicly by her in-laws for not giving birth to a boy in Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba district. As per reports, the woman had given birth to two daughters after her marriage, but her in-laws were demanding a boy. Police have booked five persons, including the victim's husband and father-in-law.

354.title: I'm getting threats to my life: Bengali singer as he apologises for 'Who is KK?' remark
354.article_body: Bengali singer Rupankar Bagchi has apologised to late singer KK's family and fans. This comes days after Rupankar was criticised for questioning the frenzy around KK, a day before his death. "I'm getting physical threats and...threats to my life," he stated. Rupankar, in a Facebook live session, had said, "Who's KK?" while adding that West Bengal has better singers.

355.title: Any type of competitive cricket will be good for SA before T20 WC: Bavuma
355.article_body: Ahead of South Africa tour of India for five T20Is, South Africa limited-overs skipper Temba Bavuma said that any type of competitive cricket is good for the team before the T20 World Cup in Australia in October. "The conditions in India don't accurately simulate conditions in Australia. In saying that, there's still a lot of benefit from playing," he added.

356.title: K'taka CM dissolves textbook revision panel, says 'open to changes'
356.article_body: Karnataka CM BS Bommai has dissolved the controversial textbook revision committee and said that the government was open to re-revising the content of the textbooks if people had objections to changes introduced by the panel. Bommai's decision came after the state Primary and Secondary Education Minister BC Nagesh submitted a report on the committee.

357.title: 'Fat finger' trade causes ₹250 crore loss in India's biggest trading mistake: Report
357.article_body: A 'fat finger' trade on the National Stock Exchange's (NSE) derivatives segment on Thursday may have caused a loss of up to ₹250 crore to an unknown brokerage house, PTI reported. This could be the biggest trading mistake in the history of the Indian market. A 'fat finger' error is a human error caused by pressing the wrong key.

358.title: 77-yr-old Mumbai man tries to get ₹1,100 refund, loses ₹8 lakh
358.article_body: A 77-year-old Mumbai resident lost ₹8 lakh of his life savings while trying to get a refund of ₹1,100. Police said the victim booked a fleet cab on May 27, which cost ₹550, but the amount was deducted thrice from e-wallet. He called the cab's customer care number, after which a person posing as an 'executive' defrauded him, police added.

359.title: Indian banned for 'faking' Everest climb in 2016 scales peak, says 'had to prove myself'
359.article_body: An Indian climber, who was banned for six years from climbing the world's highest peak in 2016, has scaled the peak. Narender Yadav claimed to have scaled Mount Everest in 2016 but his pictures were found to be digitally altered after which the Nepal government imposed the ban. "I (had to) prove myself and climb Everest," said Yadav.

360.title: Karthik can be in India's T20 WC squad if he plays Dhoni's role: Shastri
360.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik can be a part of Indian team if he plays a Dhoni-type role in 2022 T20 World Cup. He added that one has to see from the team's point of view, what are they looking for. Karthik has been included in India's squad for upcoming five-match T20I series against South Africa.

361.title: Incredibly tasteless & twisted minds: Farhan on Layer'r Shot's ads
361.article_body: Actor Farhan Akhtar reacted to the ads of body spray Layer'r Shot which have been accused of promoting rape culture and gang rape. He tweeted, "What incredibly tasteless and twisted minds it must take to think up, approve and create these stinking body spray 'gang rape' innuendo ads..!! Shameful." The Information and Broadcasting Ministry has ordered suspension of the ads.

362.title: Man jailed for 7 days for touching women inappropriately in Hyd
362.article_body: The Special Metropolitan Magistrate Court of Hyderabad sentenced a 20-year-old man, Asmaul SK, to seven days imprisonment for "touching women inappropriately" in a crowded place. Hyderabad Police said that the man was caught red-handed by She Teams in Charminar area of the city. Members of She Teams recorded the act and immediately arrested Asmaul in the case.

363.title: Not disappointed: Shahid on Jersey's box office performance
363.article_body: On being asked about the box office performance of his film 'Jersey', actor Shahid Kapoor said he is not disappointed, adding that it will always be close to his heart. The actor added, "It's been two years since COVID-19 and we need to understand how the audience feels." He further said that it is time for everyone to learn.

364.title: All Odisha ministers resign ahead of Cabinet reshuffle
364.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Saturday asked all Cabinet ministers to resign ahead of a reshuffle on June 5. The new Council of Ministers will reportedly take oath on Sunday. The reshuffle exercise began a day after the ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) won three Rajya Sabha seats unopposed and the bypoll in the Brajrajnagar Assembly constituency.

365.title: Mumbai man gets death penalty for 8-year-old girl's rape & murder
365.article_body: A special Mumbai court awarded the death penalty to Vadivel alias Gundappa Devendra, for the rape and murder of an eight-year-old girl in 2019. He committed the crime within a year of being released from jail after he was convicted of sexually assaulting another minor in 2013. Judge HC Shende said the repeat offence showed that Vadivel's reformation is impossible.

366.title: 1 in every 36 infants in India dies within 1 yr of its life: Data
366.article_body: One in every 36 infants in India dies within the first year of its life, according to official data. In 2020, the highest infant mortality rate was reported in Madhya Pradesh at 43 and the lowest IMR was reported in Mizoram at 3. However, there has been a declining trend in IMR over the past few decades, the data showed.

367.title: Rachakonda Police bust fake land registration racket, 7 arrested
367.article_body: The Special Operations Team along with Adibatla Police busted a fake land registration racket and arrested seven persons, Rachakonda Police said. A sale deed, two cars and mobile phones, all worth ₹1,02,30,000, were seized from the accused. The accused were arrested on charges of creating a forged sale deed and making efforts to take possession of vacant land.

368.title: They've propped us up: 'Ms Marvel' actor on Farhan, Fawad's cameos
368.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' actor Mohan Kapur has spoken about Farhan Akhtar and Fawad Khan's cameos in the show, saying that they propped up the show. "Just...hearing their names, the audience goes to buy tickets. They've earned that," he added. Mohan further said, "It's very small if you start thinking, 'I am in more episodes so why are they talking about them'."

369.title: Working with Vicky Kaushal was amazing, he's so talented: Sara
369.article_body: Sara Ali Khan has called working with Vicky Kaushal amazing, adding he is a talented guy. "He's so easy-going...working with him is a lot of fun," she added. The two will be seen together in Laxman Utekar's untitled film. On being asked about her dream role, Sara said she wants to play a queen in a Sanjay Leela Bhansali film.

370.title: Gill is the most difficult batter to bowl to in the nets: GT's Dayal
370.article_body: When asked about the batter he found most difficult to bowl to in the nets in IPL 2022, GT pacer Yash Dayal replied teammate "Shubman Gill". He added, "He's not late at all on any delivery. He plays cricketing shots, you have seen what a classical batter he is." Gill was GT's second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2022 with 483 runs.

371.title: Jasmin to make Bollywood debut with film penned by Mahesh Bhatt: Report
371.article_body: Television actress and former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Jasmin Bhasin will reportedly make her Bollywood debut with a film penned by Mahesh Bhatt. According to reports, the actress will start shooting for the film at the end of July this year. The film will be directed by Manish Chavan, who will be making his directorial debut with this venture, reports added.

372.title: Sarah Silverman joins cast of Bradley Cooper's film 'Maestro'
372.article_body: Actress Sarah Silverman has joined the cast of Netflix's upcoming film 'Maestro'. Based on American music composer-conductor Leonard Bernstein, the film is directed by Bradley Cooper who will be seen playing the lead role. According to Deadline, Silverman will play Bernstein's sister in the film. Besides her, the film also features Carey Mulligan, Matt Bomer and Maya Hawke.

373.title: I've retired, haven't played after losing my dad who was my no. 1 fan: Tevez
373.article_body: Ex-Manchester United forward Carlos Tevez has announced his retirement from football, adding he stopped playing because he lost his adopted father Segundo Tevez due to COVID-19 complications in February 2021. Tevez stated Segundo was his number one fan. "I used to get up at 6 am to go training...I don't have the strength to do that," he had earlier said.

374.title: 6 killed, 20 hurt as boiler explodes at chemical factory in UP's Hapur
374.article_body: At least six workers died and 20 others were injured after a boiler exploded at a chemical factory on Saturday in Uttar Pradesh's Hapur. Police and fire-tenders have rushed to the spot and rescue operations are underway. CM Yogi Adityanath has expressed grief over deaths and has directed the district administration to extend all possible help to the deceased's families.

375.title: Shakira, Gerard Piqué separate after 12 years of relationship amid cheating rumours
375.article_body: Singer Shakira and footballer Gerard Piqué said on Saturday that they are separating after 12 years of relationship. "We regret to confirm that we are separating. For the well-being of our children, who are our highest priority, we request respect for (our) privacy," they said in a statement. This comes amid reports that Shakira caught Piqué cheating on her.

376.title: Kartik Aaryan tests positive for COVID-19 for 2nd time
376.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to social media on Saturday to inform that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "Sab kuch itna positive chal raha tha, Covid se raha nahi gaya (Everything was going so well, Covid couldn't bear to be left out)," the actor wrote. Notably, this is the second time that Kartik has tested positive for the virus.

377.title: Illegal properties of Kanpur violence accused to be demolished: UP Police
377.article_body: The illegal properties of the accused allegedly involved in the violence that broke out in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur on Friday will be demolished, UP Police Additional Director General (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said on Saturday. "The situation has been brought under control. Identification of the accused is being done," he said. "Action will be taken against them," Kumar added.

378.title: Masks not mandatory, there's no fine but I request public to wear them: Maha minister
378.article_body: After a Maharashtra government official said masks were mandatory in closed spaces, the state's Health Minister Rajesh Tope refuted it, saying there's no fine for not wearing masks. However, he appealed to the public in the state to wear masks in spaces like buses, schools, trains and offices. This came amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra.

379.title: 2 UN peacekeepers killed by bomb blast in Mali
379.article_body: Two United Nations peacekeepers were killed and two others were injured after their vehicle was hit by an improvised explosive device in Mali on Friday, according to UN Spokesperson Stéphane Dujarric. It's the second fatal attack this week on a peacekeeping convoy in the West African country, an official statement said. A peacekeeper was killed in an attack on Wednesday.

380.title: 4 former Punjab Congress ministers join BJP in Amit Shah's presence
380.article_body: Former Punjab Congress ministers Balbir Singh Sidhu, Raj Kumar Verka, Sunder Sham Arora and Gurpreet Singh Kangar joined the BJP in Chandigarh on Saturday in Home Minister Amit Shah's presence. Former Congress leader KS Dhillon and former SAD MLA SC Singla are also reportedly set to join BJP. State Congress chief ASR Warring called the switchovers "a blessing in disguise".

381.title: Corbevax approved as COVID-19 booster shot for those aged 18 yrs & above
381.article_body: Biological E on Saturday announced its COVID-19 vaccine Corbevax has been approved by Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI) for administering booster doses to people aged 18 years and above. Corbevax was earlier approved for emergency use in kids aged 5-12 years and 12-15 years. Adults fully vaccinated with two doses of Covishield or Covaxin can take a Corbevax booster.

382.title: Don't believe social media rumours, I'm not interested in elections: Moosewala's father
382.article_body: Late Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala's father, in a video shared on Instagram, urged people to not believe in social media rumours. "I am not interested in any election," he stated. He further invited people to Moosewala's Bhog on June 8 and thanked them for their support. Moosewala was shot dead on Sunday.

383.title: US-based email startup Superhuman fires 22% staff amid downturn
383.article_body: California-based email startup Superhuman has fired 23 employees, which made up about 22% of its workforce. CEO Rahul Vohra made the announcement on Twitter while attributing the layoffs to a "downturn that could last years". He added that the 23 employees will be provided with a generous severance package, support throughout the year and assistance in looking for new jobs.

384.title: PM Modi stopped Russia-Ukraine war for 3 hrs to evacuate Indians: BJP leader
384.article_body: Senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad on Friday claimed Prime Minister Narendra Modi stopped the Russia-Ukraine war for three hours to evacuate Indian students stranded in Ukraine. "PM spoke to Russian President...his Ukrainian counterpart...to stop the war so that the Indian...students could be evacuated," Prasad claimed. "The PM [said]...he would not leave his children in a war zone," he added.

385.title: Woman's body found half-buried, crushed with stone in Jharkhand
385.article_body: A woman's body was found half-buried and crushed to death with a stone in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district. The body was found to have been hurriedly buried by the assailants and wrapped in a shroud, police said. Notably, the deceased's age is believed to be in the mid-30s, police added. Meanwhile, the body has been sent to hospital for post-mortem.

386.title: Driver killed, 8 people injured as high-speed train derails in China
386.article_body: A high-speed train derailed in southwestern China on Saturday, killing the driver and injuring at least eight people, state broadcaster CCTV reported. All other 136 passengers were safe. The train was running from Guiyang to Guangzhou province when the two coaches derailed at a tunnel entrance after it ploughed into debris deposited on the tracks by a mudslide, CCTV said.

387.title: Hardik should play only T20Is till T20 WC, playing ODIs a risk: Shastri
387.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said all-rounder Hardik Pandya should only play T20Is till the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, adding it will be a "risk" if Hardik is asked to play ODIs. Shastri stated Hardik's availability across departments makes a massive difference and changes the whole balance in India's favour. "He does the job for two players," said Shastri.

388.title: B'luru man strangles mother to death with saree for not buying him phone
388.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested a 26-year-old man for allegedly strangling his mother to death with her saree. The accused, identified as Deepak, went to help his mother who used to pluck and sell leafy vegetables. He later called his father and said she was found dead. After inquiry, police discovered that Deepak killed his mother for not buying him a phone.

389.title: I'm really looking forward to 'No Entry 2', the script is hilarious: Fardeen
389.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan has said that he's very excited about 'No Entry 2', a sequel to his 2005 film. "I'm really, really looking forward to that...I've heard the story and the script and let me tell you it's hilarious. It's got to be double, triple the fun," he added. Anil Kapoor and Salman Khan will also return for the sequel.

390.title: Action against those responsible for Visakhapatnam gas leak: Chandrababu Naidu
390.article_body: Former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu has said that "action should be taken" against those responsible for the recent gas leak incident in a Visakhapatnam-based laboratory in which around 200 workers fell ill. "The failure of the government departments and absence of monitoring has become a curse for the public," Naidu said.

391.title: No way Google CEO doesn't know about caste: Dalit activist whose talk was cancelled
391.article_body: Dalit rights activist Thenmozhi Soundararajan, whose talk on caste bias was cancelled by Google after some employees' protest, said there's no way that Google CEO Sundar Pichai doesn't know about caste. "[Pichai] is Indian and he is Brahmin and he grew up in Tamil Nadu," she told the Washington Post, adding that Pichai must make a statement regarding this controversy.

392.title: Only Indian money funds war? EAM on criticism over India buying Russian oil
392.article_body: EAM S Jaishankar rejected criticism from the West that India's purchase of Russian oil is helping fund the Ukraine war. Jaishankar said, "If India buying Russian oil is funding the war...Tell me...buying Russian gas isn't funding the war? It's only Indian money and Russian oil coming to India funding the war and not Russia's gas coming to Europe not funding?"

393.title: 'Anupamaa' gave me popularity that Robot 2.0 could not: Sudhanshu
393.article_body: Sudhanshu Pandey, who plays the role of Vanraj Shah in 'Anupamaa', has said he had never imagined that the show would become "such a huge hit". "I've done...Hollywood film and...Robot 2.0. I've worked with Jackie Chan, Rajnikanth, Akshay Kumar...But the popularity I got from 'Anupamaa', I've not experienced anything like this before even after doing these big-budget films," he said.

394.title: Duo jailed, fined ₹1 lakh each in hash oil case: Bengaluru police
394.article_body: Bengaluru DCP (South East Division) Joshi Srinath Mahadev on Saturday said that two people, Johnson and Biju, have been sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment in a hash oil case. The accused have also been fined ₹1 lakh each in the case. "Congrats SG Palya police...Our commitment against drug offences is unquestionable," the DCP added.

395.title: Wasn't sure I'll be picked after first 2 IPL 2022 games: CSK's Mukesh
395.article_body: CSK pacer Mukesh Choudhary said he was "confused" about what he was doing wrong after his first two IPL 2022 matches for CSK, adding he wasn't sure if he would be picked for the remaining matches. "[However] the...management backed me," added Mukesh. Mukesh picked 16 wickets in 13 IPL 2022 matches and had a bowling strike rate of 17.

396.title: Will talk to Bajaj to start ethanol-run scooter-auto in Pune: Gadkari
396.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari has requested Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar to come together to call a meeting with Bajaj Auto, saying, "We'll speak to Bajaj to start scooter-auto in Pune on 100% ethanol." "I went behind [PM Narendra Modi]...got three Indian Oil ethanol pumps in Pune but not a single drop of it (is) sold yet," he added.

397.title: Monkeypox suspected in 5-year-old girl in UP, samples sent for testing
397.article_body: A 5-year-old girl in UP's Ghaziabad is suspected to have been infected with the monkeypox virus, the UP government has said, adding that her samples have been sent to ICMR-NIV, Pune for testing. The girl complained of itching and rashes, the state government said. Neither she nor any of her close relatives travelled abroad in the past month, it added.

398.title: Nepal Women dismissed for 8 runs vs UAE in U19 T20 WC qualifier, 6 players record ducks
398.article_body: Nepal Women were bowled out for 8 runs in 8.1 overs against UAE in an ICC U19 Women's T20 World Cup Asia Qualifier 2022 match. Six Nepal players recorded ducks, while Sneha Mahara top-scored with three runs off 10 balls. UAE chased down the target in 1.1 overs. UAE's Mahika Gaur recorded figures of 4-2-2-5.

399.title: Sec 144 imposed in Karnataka's Mandya after VHP calls for rally
399.article_body: Section 144 CrPC has been imposed in the Srirangapatna town in Karnataka's Mandya after the Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) called for a 'Srirangapatna Chalo' march on Saturday. The restrictions will be in place from 6 am to 6 pm. Over 500 police personnel have been deployed and CCTV cameras and four check posts have been installed to secure the area.

400.title: Will install 500 Tricolours in Delhi by August 15: CM Kejriwal
400.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said the AAP government will install 500 Tricolours in the national capital by August 15. "A five-member committee will be formed for each flag to ensure the Flag Code of India," he added. Kejriwal said the committees should gather people at the flags' location at 10 am every Sunday to sing the National Anthem.
